thread.title: Cinema screenings of Sherlock special 'The Abominable Bride' come complete with added bonus content
thread.title_full: Cinema screenings of Sherlock special 'The Abominable Bride' come complete with added bonus content

title: Cinema screenings of Sherlock special 'The Abominable Bride' come complete with added bonus content
text:
Sunday, Oct 25 2015, 00:01 BST Share on Facebook Share on Twitter Share on Google+ Over 100 cinemas will be simulcasting the highly-anticipated Sherlock special on January 1, 2016, and now BBC are sharing further details of what fans can expect from the screenings.And if the words exclusive bonus content do not appeal to you, we suggest you look away now. 
© BBC In addition to showing the one-off, 90-minute Victorian Sherlock special, those who book their cinema seats will also get to see extra filmed material, including a guided tour of 221B Baker Street from co-creator and executive producer Steven Moffat and a look behind the scenes at how the special episode was made featuring all the lead cast and crew.The upcoming special's title - 'The Abominable Bride' - was announced today (October 24) during the Sherlock panel at MCM London Comic Con, where it was also confirmed that fans could book their tickets for the cinema event from Monday, November 2." Sherlock on the big screen. For us, it's a giant leap backwards - into Victorian London," Moffat said in a statement. "The mean streets of 1895 have never looked so good!" 
© BBC Benedict Cumberbatch and Martin Freeman will reprise their roles as Holmes and Watson in the special, while series regulars Rupert Graves, Una Stubbs, Louise Brealey and Amanda Abbingdon are all also set to return.In addition to the UK, further countries participating in showing Sherlock in cinemas will be confirmed in due course, although last week it was confirmed that China will be involved in screening the special .For full listings of participating UK cinemas, visit Sherlockology .Watch a trailer for the special below:
